dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Just over 77,000 births in Kazakhstan in the first quarter of 2025—that's the lowest it's been in 11 years.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The number of births in Kazakhstan has fallen to its lowest point in 11 years, with just over 77,000 children born in the first quarter of 2025, according to data from the First Credit Bureau (FCB).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that's a 16 percent drop from last year, which is, like, a really sharp decline.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just one area either—every single region saw a decrease.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just one area either-every single region saw a decrease.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2025, declines have been recorded across all regions of the country, with the sharpest drops seen in the Akmola region and the Zhetysu region, down 22 percent and 20.1 percent, respectively.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And rural areas are actually seeing an even steeper decline than urban ones, which is interesting.

dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So maybe we'll see a slight rebound later, but still, the trend is clearly downward.

dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And given that it hasn't dipped below 90,000 in a full year for over a decade, this is pretty significant.
